website_summaries.verdict: The Backup Plus Fast is an excellent choice for anyone, especially those for those needing lots of storage space or the ability to edit videos on the go.
pros: The Seagate Backup Plus Fast is indeed extremely fast, and includes helpful backup software
The drive also provides top capacity, and is bus-powered
cons: Users can't change the internal drives
the RAID 0 setup might result in a higher risk of data loss

customer_reviews.title: Def worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have had this hd for quite some time now, and have not had any issues with it. I use it for my videos and photos, and have stored 2 terabytes of data on it so for with no issues. It is fairly fast, fast enough to play 4K content on my MacBook, as I store all my Final Cut Pro X videos to it. It also has a nice remote feature that works very well with the cloud storage they give you for a year. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Azboarder23

customer_reviews.title: Always a fan, but this model in particular...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Large capacity. It does it's job of holding all my value files. 2. Compact, and portable. Cons: 1. I have owned nothing but Seagate hard drives and this one heats up quick tremendously. It is pretty warm to the touch, especially when using or transferring files. 2. Does not connect to my Wi-Fi router. My router does not recognize it, therefore I can not use this Seagate as a home network cloud like I intended. All my other Seagate HDs connect to my router just fine?! Not really the hard drive's fault, but it is really unfortunate. I will always be a fan of Seagate. Just wish my router could recognize it.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be made of 2 laptop hard drives in ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be made of 2 laptop hard drives in a RAID. Speeds around 240 MB/s. Although it is quite a bit faster than the 1TB Toshiba I have (which has a single drive,) I worry that in the long run it will not be as durable. When either drive in a 2-disk RAID fails, you lose all the data. If your data doesn't exist in at least 2 seperate locations, as they say, it doesn't exist. Always back up important stuff in at least 2 different locations (family pictures, tax records, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Delores Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Fastest HDD I've ever seen
customer_reviews.text: So I am writing this review after two years of using this product. once I was using this HDD for 7 days with no break! Nothing happened to it! It works like a tank and the fact that it is actually to HDDs combined makes it way faster than other HDDs. I copied a 120 gb file as fast as 5 mins from this to my laptop. Strongly recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Adel

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This has failed me after 3 months and barely any usage. I used it for my trip to the Philippines and it worked on the 28 hour flight, and while there for 2 weeks, and the flight back, and when I used my laptop. Problem is. I pulled it out for the first time today... No good. It is desperately trying to spin up and you can hear it failing. Glad I only copied files on it vs cut and paste. Now its time for the warranty process. I hope this is smooth. Black unit Purchased from Best Buy
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dale Pleis III

customer_reviews.title: I'm on my second drive in less than a week (thanks for the easy return of #1
customer_reviews.text: Well, I'm on my second drive in less than a week (thanks for the easy return of #1, Amazon). Both heated up to a blistering temperature after 10 to 15 minutes of data transfer. The first one literally smelled like it was burning. Both units would periodically just stop transferring data. I'd hear a little "ping" and then the transfer rate went to 0mb/s. Sending the second one back and looking for a different manufacturer as this thing seems like a fire hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Morris

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for more than a year. The Read/ Write speed is incredible. I didn't use it in any intensive backup but i used it now and then to copy or backup files and games, movies ,... ect. didn't notice any issue and everything is smooth and as expected. As a home user i recommend it. ( Don't know how will it be in intensive use )
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: It really is as fast as they claim. RAID configuration makes it inherently less reliable than other drives
customer_reviews.text: I use this hard drive for video editing on my Macbook Pro. My laptop has an internal SSD which is exceptionally fast and makes video editing far less frustrating, but I keep all of my stock on these drives and sometimes have to edit material stored on them. I can't recommend it enough for size and speed... Be forewarned however that the way the two hard drives inside this enclosure are linked if one fails, it all fails, which increases your chance for data loss.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Flood

customer_reviews.title: Formatted a partition for MAC and Windows
customer_reviews.text: working great so far, will see after a 6 month deployment. The 4TB comes as a single slotted disk space, but I formatted a partition for 2TB FAT system and 2TB for MAC OS Journaled. I use the FAT side for backing up my Dell Precision 6800 and the MAC side for Encrypted Time Machine backups of my File Vault encrypted MacBook Pro with a Samsung SSD hard drive. When I hook up the partitioned drive to my MacBook, both the FAT & MAC OS partitioned sides show up on my MacbookPro desktop at the same time. Same same for hooking up to my Windows 7 laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: It was working well until the USB 3 connector became loose. Now you have to hold the cable for it to read and sometimes not even that works. Goodbye, 4TB of pictures. Strangely this hard drive was static on my table and not being transported. Not the first time Seagate makes a bad HardDrive. I almost lost all the data for this. Beware and go with something else.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reck

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised. I also have a Backup Plus 4tb. This new one is at least 20% faster. I was amazed at how small it is. So nice not to need a power supply. Don't need to use the included usb with an extra plug to add power if the single connection doesn't provide enough. It does get hot; I'm surprised it doesn't have any ventilation holes.
customer_reviews.author: finetunes

customer_reviews.title: Jump on this deal! Best 4TB Portable Hard Drive that there is
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 4TB version, and I was blown away. This will more than likely outrun the drive in your pc. The secret ingredient is actually 2 internal HDD's, set up in RAID 0, so every read/write is split between the drives and run simultaneously. Couple that with USB 3.0, and you have the fastest 4TB drive under $200 EVER. It comes with 2 USB cords: a standard USB 3.0, and a USB 3.0 Y cable just in case your pc doesn't have quite enough juice for this beefy drive. No AC adapter necessary! (Which is impressive, considering the dual HDDs)
customer_reviews.author: David Loveless

customer_reviews.title: Fast 4TB drive, great value!
customer_reviews.text: This 4TB drive is well worth the small price difference, between this drive and slower models. The drive can fit into a medium size jacket pocket, so it is somewhat portable. This drive works by connecting included cable to USB port and responds quickly when selected for use. I used Amazon Prime to have the drive shipped to me. I received it in about a day or two. Great value, good deal.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: I love this hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I love this hard drive. I was a bit concerned when ordering it as I didnt want anything extremely bulky. This product however is about the size of your hand and about a inch thick. It came with two power USB adaptors, just in case one does not draw enough power, the other will work perfectly. It has 4 TB of space which is great as I do alot of recording from Itunes movies and music. There is no external software that has to be installed, so that is a definite plus. It is extremely portable making it one of the best investments I have made.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Love these drives.
customer_reviews.text: I own 4 of these so far (I edit video) and to date none have failed or faltered. Not as fast as thunderbolt obviously but can easily edit 1080p footage straight from the drive, have even worked with 4K off these guys - and while a bit laggy - it's to be expected, I was amazed it could even hold up to the task. Great, reliable, ultra portable and fast! BTW I also own a 18TB thunderbold raid but use these to go on set or scene, as mentioned with the exception of 4K I notice almost no difference between this and my RAID when working with standard HD on my MBP.
customer_reviews.author: lawlhammer

customer_reviews.title: Very finicky about power, not worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the trouble. Super finicky about power, really wants to be plugged directly into a Macbook Pro or Mini port. Not usable with my Macbook 2016 through a dongle, even when using its "Y" USB cable with the power cable plugged into a separate powered USB port. It was even unreliable (timemachine backups would fail) with my Mini when plugged into a (powered!) USB 3 hub.
customer_reviews.author: Jamshid Afshar

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: replaced/backed-up/consolidated my older hard drives into this unit. It's been months now, haven't had any hiccups. It's plugged into my NAS and i have been accessing it on the regular. It should also consume much less power than the two 2TB drives I replaced (even though they're green drives, they required power adapters, this drive doesn't). This drive only requires the single USB 3.0 port, and my NAS happen to have a USB 3.0 port, so everything fits. The closet my NAS and this hard rive sits in does feel a little cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Leung

customer_reviews.title: buyer beware - not working with surface pro 2
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine when I used the two-headed Y cable, but when connecting to the Surface with the single connection, I am seeing classic behaviour of an external drive that is hungry for power. Booting with it connected seems to take forever, applications freeze, ultimately was never able to see drive contents at all. I'll update this if/when I see progress but for now, big red flag not working at all as a mobile drive with my Surface Pro 2.
customer_reviews.author: borax99

customer_reviews.title: I love it, you should buy it
customer_reviews.text: Solid drive, I love it, you should buy it, and it lives up to its name. It's FAST. I think it is worth the extra money. Just make sure you're backed up—RAID arrays are more susceptible to failure over the long term.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff L.

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Reliable, Frequent Corruption of Files on MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Used it with my Mac to keep my iTunes library externally. Unfortunately would randomly disconnect and several times corrupt the iTunes library, which is a major pain. I finally gave up and purchased another 4 TB Fantom Drive with native Mac formatting and Firewire connector. Much more reliable, haven't had a single corrupt iTunes file. Would not buy this Seagate for Mac usage, despite the indication that it supports both formats.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Kroll

customer_reviews.title: 4 TB Drive is Very Unreliable!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not usually one to take the time to write reviews, but in this case, I'm compelled to as this particular Seagate Drive has failed not once, but twice! I bought this drive 2 weeks ago, and it failed after a few days, so I returned it to Amazon and ordered another one thinking it was a fluke. Now the second one has failed too, and again, after only a few days of use. I wanted to use this drive as my Time Machine backup on Mac, and in each case, Time Machine eventually fails to back up to the disk, and Disk Utility on Mac is unable to repair the disk, and the problem resurfaces after reformatting the disk.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Lawton

customer_reviews.title: Had Some Setup Issues, But Windows Sees It OK Now
customer_reviews.text: It's really nice to have such a large drive in such a small, portable package. Windows 7 and 8.1 didn't want to see the drive right away, but did after some fiddling. Perhaps I didn't follow instructions (which I didn't read first, I admit, given that I owned a computer business for years). I recommend that purchasers DO read the manual and install whatever Seagate says to, which will likely save you some of the time I wasted attempting to get this beast seen by Windows. All's well that ends well and I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J. Boone

customer_reviews.title: LOST EVERYTHING
customer_reviews.text: I had all kinds of important data that was lost completely and this is the second time I've had crap like this happen on seagate hard drives. I recommend nobody EVER use any of their products
customer_reviews.author: G. H.

customer_reviews.title: Got the drive. Connect to my desktop, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Got the drive. Connect to my desktop, but the drive not showing up. While browse the internet trying to figure out what's going on, I notice the drive became extremely hot! So hot that I could almost cooking egg using it. Disconnect and return.
customer_reviews.author: Chirasi

customer_reviews.title: Its Life Didn't Meet Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive in Feb 2016, it died in Dec 2017. I would expect this drive to last longer than 1.8 years. It worked well during its life and is easy and straight forward to use. I would just expect it to last longer. You may want to consider portable drive by another manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: 4TB Portable External
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these now. They have all been great. The risk with these is to backup / store data on them as a sole storage location. I suggest you back it up! The drives do get pretty warm when working them, I would not recommend storing them in air tight cases when heavily using them, this may result in their premature demise. I also suggest you encrypt the partition/drive before you start using it.
customer_reviews.author: ktmrider

customer_reviews.title: Seagate is an Excellent Choice/Takes Very Little Space
customer_reviews.text: Simply can’t go wrong with a Seagate product. Takes very little space, always works and easy to travel with (if needed).
customer_reviews.author: Marin Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Game-changer
customer_reviews.text: I don't think people realize what an incredible product this is. Not everyone uses large drives for long-term storage, many professions like computer forensics and digital video editing require large capacity, portability, and very fast speeds, while the risk of Raid failure is not a concern as archive copies will be made. The BUP Fast is basically a 4TB portable drive with SSD-like write speeds for <$250.
customer_reviews.author: The Notorious A.G.A.

customer_reviews.title: Power Hog
customer_reviews.text: The best rating I can give is three stars. Yes, it holds a whole lot of stuff, and yes its pretty fast. BUT IT IS A POWER HOG! When powered only on my laptop's busspower, videos will lock up. The only way I can get it to work consistently with my laptop is to connect it to a POWERED USB hub. (I/e, one with a separate power adapter) such as the Amazon Basics one at
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: No power cable needed just 3.0 USB
customer_reviews.text: Have bought Western Digital for years! Just started buying Seagate HD's and love them! This is a usb only cable. HD. No power cable is needed! High transfer speeds! greater than my 3.0 WD's. Cloud is easy to setup but I don't know if they promote very well that its only 2 years then after that if you want your data you pay the monthly.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Hardware, Software forced but Sufficient
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, reliable drive. I also own the 2TB version. Both have never failed me, and are as fast as any other external drive for loading music files into Music production software. I also don't mind the Seagate software it comes with, although it is a bit of a bummer you are forced to use it if you want to use the drives.
customer_reviews.author: NachoPicasso

customer_reviews.title: Seagate great price, maybe not the most reliable when used in NTFS format on Mac OS
customer_reviews.text: Has had media problems for about 1 year...have reformatted twice after backing up data to another drive. This is my second Seagate to fail. This one made it out of the two year warranty with data protection by 1 month...A prior Seagate was replaced and data recovered with in the two year warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: DrugDoc

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I've heard for years to avoid Seagate drives but I stupidly ignored that advice. I chose to give this one a try and sure enough it died after only two years. I'll never be trying their drives again. I have had Western Digital drives that have lasted for over five years and they're still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K.

customer_reviews.title: Huge and Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Seagate isn't kidding when they say this drive is fast. I set this drive with Time Machine and was able to backup 250GB to it in just 20 minutes. That's 200MB/s write speed. The drive itself is quiet, but a bit heavy for a portable drive and it does get hot to the touch. I would not leave this connected when not being used. But it's fast, and huge, and for those two reasons I give 5-stars.
customer_reviews.author: Holland Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Got this for my Xbox One and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Hard Drive for my Xbox One because 500 gb internal was not enough seeing as how an average game is almost 50 GB alone. This HD is awesome period. For the memory capacity and overall size and weight you just cannot complain about this product. I now store all my games on this HD for my Xbox One and plan on never having to buy another external hard drive again. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for a HD for their Xbox One.
customer_reviews.author: Gucci

customer_reviews.title: It's "External" but not recommended as "Portable"
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to use as a portable drive to go on trips, but when I got it and read the material that came with it I found out it was suitable for use as an external drive, but not really recommended as a travelling accessory. Amazon took it back without question and I bought a Western Digital My Book 4tb as a travelling drive. Been happy with that one.
customer_reviews.author: L. Vest

customer_reviews.title: Great 4TB portable drive
customer_reviews.text: So glad seagate came out with a 4TB drive. I'm a freelance graphic designer/photographer. I save a lot of picture and Adobe Software files on my drive. So far it has made my life easier from moving all my files from a 2TB Seagate portable drive to the 4TB. Transfer speeds were good (in my opinion). I'm a mac user, so I reformatted it to MAC OS Journaled and my macs read/write has been great. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: keystylz

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Like others, worked for a few weeks, now it is nothing short of problematic. Seems to work fine on my Windows 7 Home desktop, but I get I/O errors and messages that the drive needs to be formatted on a Windows 7 Pro desktop. Worked for awhile on my Windows 8.1 laptop, then started having issues connecting and also was told by my OS that the drive needed formatting. Hours wasted trying to get it to work. And just like someone else, I am 2 weeks and 3 days past my Amazon return window. All my WD portable drives have worked flawlessly. My first Seagate experience is nothing short of frustration. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for 200, a bit expensive. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for 200, a bit expensive. I got this because I desperately need something more than 2T. Have reading failure couple of times, replugged and it's okay, no data loss yet (just 2 months in). Update: just lost some data, about 5 months in, regret buying this. Update2: it's more than a year now. Again just lost ~1TB of data, had to reformat, I'm really pissed. Now I can't use it for anything fearing the loss of data
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, although you need to be careful plugging in more than 1 unit to your computer as these require heavy power. When using a powered USB hub, the connection seems to drop at random. I bought 4 of these to attach to my NAS.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Great for the first year!
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great!... For a year. The drive is now failing, and I had to buy a different drive just to backup all the files on it before they were gone forever.
customer_reviews.author: Blase Zinck

customer_reviews.title: Short & sweet - I have had several of these
customer_reviews.text: Short & sweet - I have had several of these, every one has worked as advertised, is fast as blazes, and does a great job. No malfunctions, and unlike their "larger brothers" in dedicated powered enclosures these don't switch themselves off - which is why I moved to the portable external devices for Windows backup. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: firewallbillTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Dependable Seagate massive storage, just could need 2x USB slots if using USB 2.0
customer_reviews.text: Works really well without any issues. The only tricky part is if you are using an older computer with USB 2.0 then you may need to use the dual cable for power (included), just like the original USB external drives from a decade ago, still works great in such a setup but you'll have to dedicate 2 USB power slots to it if that situation applies to you, unless of course you have a newer computer or USB 3.0 slots.
customer_reviews.author: Prof. Dr. Sir.

customer_reviews.title: Takes a beating but gets hot
customer_reviews.text: It gets very hot. On the flip side, I travel a great deal and a couple wonderful TSA agents have dropped it... twice. The case is pretty smashed up (I know this can be replaced, I'm just too lazy to do it just yet) but it still runs just fine with no problems. I only use this for media and not everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Good drive, but ultraportable computers may need a second computer nearby just to provide enough USB power.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, very fast. But one thing that isn't well-advertised is that some machines don't provide enough USB power to run this drive, so they include a Y-cable with a "power only" USB connector. If you're going to use this drive with a small ultraportable tablet or computer, you might need to have a beefier computer just sitting powered on nearby to use this drive. Otherwise, this would've been a 5-star review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Running like a champ
customer_reviews.text: Running like a champ and not any issues. My only complaint is sometimes it needs both usb cords plugged in for adequate power. With only one cord it starts beeping as if to say I'm dying more juice please. When I plug in the second cord it stops beeping. Maybe it's my motherboard configuration, but I don't require hard core usage either.
customer_reviews.author: Simps

customer_reviews.title: Super fast, quiet, compact
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 4tb version of this drive. It is super compact, quiet, and bus powered. Running Blackmagic SppedDisk test I get 230mb/s read/write, which is twice as fast as a usual external drive. I also tried a similar product from Western Digital, which was twice as large and $100 more. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: My view not good product for Mac
customer_reviews.text: Well it is not plug and play for mac. Would not let me set up partition as logging. I had to format the drive. My view not good product for Mac. But I'm using it. But I'm not very confident. ok well. Now its not working at all. Acts like mounting not working. But I can go into system and see files, the hard way. Don't buy it for a mac
customer_reviews.author: MIke

customer_reviews.title: DOA.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift for a friend whose birthday was a little beyond the 30 day return window. Item is DOA, tried different cables, computers, ports, etc, no joy. I contacted the manufacturer, and they will warranty it but I will have to pay shipping and handling. Lesson learned, will go direct in the future.
customer_reviews.author: RomanG

customer_reviews.title: 2 Drives Both Crashed After Less Than 2 Months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this from Amazon when it first became available. The first one crashed after less than 2 months of use. The replacement from Amazon also crashed after less than 2 months of use. Amazon declined to send me a third one and gave me a full refund instead, but told me that I could purchase it again in the future if I wanted. Looks like there is a problem with the early batches. Hopefully there are some updates for the later production and they are more reliable. I like the idea of a portable 4TB drive, but hopefully the reliability bugs can be worked out quickly, and I can get another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great on PS4 and Xbox one.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the HD for my Xbox one and PS4. Both hard drives work great and see no difference running on internal hardware drive or these plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Oram

customer_reviews.title: This would get zero stars if that were an option ...
customer_reviews.text: This would get zero stars if that were an option! Segate produces a piece of SH !t product which you will need to pay to retrieve all of your data off of when it crashes in less than a year. I will NOT buy another segate product!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry with you
customer_reviews.text: This little thing rocks. Easy to carry with you. Blazing fast on USB 3.0. Lots of space to allow a true backup regimen without having to worry about space. It's quiet, too. The only way I can tell it's running is when I touch it. Even then it's almost indistinguishable. I would recommend this highly. Sure you're going to pay a little more for it. But there's no doubt you get bang for those bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Checkmate46

customer_reviews.title: impressive portable drive
customer_reviews.text: This drive is very nice with the Y adapter usb cord and 2 open usb slots on your computer I have been able to reach 180/mps it draws its power from ubs no power cord or adapters needed
customer_reviews.author: Chrysalis

customer_reviews.title: My favorite external harddrives for video editing on-the-go
customer_reviews.text: My favorite external harddrives for video editing on-the-go. These RAID drives are faster than the regular Backup Plus drives which speeds up file transfer on set considerably. Having the 4TB capacity is awesome when working w/ RED footage. Price-point and value is unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H.

customer_reviews.title: may take 2 usb plugs in order to work.
customer_reviews.text: I have a dozen backups - all Seagate. This did not show up and never loaded. When I checked the instructions it said it may need to be plugged into 2 usb ports to get enough power. That was a red flag for me so I am returning it. Now I understand why so many got hot and failed.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Fine while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Only two years of VERY light use (once a week, maybe), and this thing just died. Fine while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: phoDOGrapher

customer_reviews.title: Got 3 of those, 1 failed withing 30 days ...
customer_reviews.text: Got 3 of those, 1 failed withing 30 days, luckily only put 80 GB on it. Computer does not recognize it. Run Seagate diagnostic; its suggestion; stop running it immediately and sand the drive to Seagate; Seagate will try to fix it for I think $500.00 plus. Does it sound ridiculous to you? It does to me. Last Seagate I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M

customer_reviews.title: Works for Xbox One
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 4TB version for my Xbox One and have been using it with no issues at all for a few months now. It's performing as expected, gives me much more space for my games. It's very quiet, and the performance has made a good difference, it's faster than the internal HDD on the Xbox and I notice on some games that I'm the first one to load into multiplayer lobbies.
customer_reviews.author: IIIT3III

customer_reviews.title: Bad.
customer_reviews.text: I plugged in this device into my Surface Pro 3 and right from the start it did not work . Apparantly the device drivers cannot load. I tried updating drivers and did not work. I tried uninstalling it , it did not work. I will return it unless someone contacts with where I can get proper drivers for this. Bad.
customer_reviews.author: Pereira Family

customer_reviews.title: Avoid if using for Apple
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work with apple products.. while it will maintain storage - the features don't work - it was a sale item so probably okay - but don't buy if you plan to use with iOS or OS.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as portable as I would have expected due to needing 2 USB sources to power the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little drive
customer_reviews.text: And I mean little! I have 5 different (some "portable") external hard drives, that I've accumulated, but this is so much smaller. It's working well. Little disappointed to find that drive speed is only 5400 RPM -- I had expected 7200 RPM so I took a star off for that.
customer_reviews.author: Brian5

customer_reviews.title: Just received it and trying to download the software "Dashboard" ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received it and trying to download the software "Dashboard" and it comes with 404 error from there internet site. I call for tech support, they say the site is down. And when I ask "When will the site be back up", they said they don't know. In addition, the tech support said he can "insert" the old version into my computer, which means I have let the guy snoop around my computer and insert the software into it. I DON'T THINK SO.
